As of January 13, 2026, analysts note that this structure points to a possible move toward the $190 level, especially as market conditions for altcoins continue to improve.
This outlook is supported by steady inflows into crypto-focused ETFs, reflecting growing institutional interest and a more constructive market mood overall. Bitwise has expanded its presence in Europe by listing seven crypto ETPs on Nasdaq Stockholm, providing Swedish investors with regulated access to Bitcoin,  $ETH, and  $SOL. These products are denominated in the Swedish krona, making them more accessible to local investors who prefer exposure without dealing directly with crypto custody.
This move reflects growing institutional and retail demand for compliant crypto investment products in traditional markets. By offering ETPs on a major exchange, Bitwise is helping bridge the gap between digital assets and conventional finance, while supporting broader adoption through familiar investment structures.

#BTC Price Analysis# #Macro Insights# #Altcoin Season#

$SOL All the short liquidations that happened since yesterday on the tradersâ€™ side are actually very easy to understand.


When the majority of people have the idea that BTC will go to 70k, that same majority opens massive short positions. This is very often used by big players to liquidate traders on a large scale.


Many traders short every red candle, and then they get caught by violent rebounds.


Itâ€™s important to understand the system: the 70k zone is a trap support ğŸª¤, created to trigger emotions among traders. These emotions push them to open millions in short positions. This benefits the big players, because it becomes easy money to liquidate with only a small amount of liquidity injected into the market, allowing them to make even more profit.


Thatâ€™s why the market will never drop in a straight line to 70k. They will always exploit massive liquidations on both sides (long and short) until traders no longer have enough money to keep shorting.


Only then will they use other strategies to reach their main objective.


For now, the market is highly manipulated and full of traps. Suivre ma stratÃ©gie sur mon profil

$SOL  â€” Pullback, not panic, Context > noise ğŸ§  TL;DR: SOL ~$145, after a +15% impulse. Funding normalized, OI stable (~$8.8B), no cascade liquidations. This move is digestion, not distribution. Macro noise (Clarity Act) is being misread â€” banks arenâ€™t â€œwinningâ€, the market is just repricing where yield belongs.  ğŸ“Š Structure & price: SOL rejected the mid-$150s and pulled back into prior acceptance. Daily structure holds above ~$136â€“138, 4H higher-lows intact. RSI cooled from overbought into neutral â€” classic pause after expansion, not trend failure.  âš– Derivatives & positioning: Open Interest barely dipped while price retraced â†’ leverage wasnâ€™t flushed aggressively. Funding cooled instead of flipping deeply negative. Translation: positioning adjusted, not abandoned.  ğŸŒ Macro context (why the narrative sounds scarier than it is): Clarity Act discussions are being framed as â€œbanks winningâ€, but the actual pressure is on stablecoin yield products, not on L1 execution chains. The market is separating passive yield stories from active utility networks. Thatâ€™s not bearish â€” itâ€™s a filter. Why this matters for SOL: When yield narratives fade, attention rotates back to throughput, activity, and ecosystems that actually move value. SOL doesnâ€™t need a yield promise â€” it needs usage. And thatâ€™s exactly where it competes best.  â˜• Coffee-table dialogue: â€” â€œLooks heavyâ€¦ is this the top?â€ â€” â€œNo. This is where weak hands ask questions and strong trends take a breath.â€  ğŸ“Œ Takeaway: Not every red candle is a warning. Sometimes itâ€™s the market checking its balance after running uphill. Structure first. Headlines later.

A critical observation about AI applications:

The monetization logic of consumer AI is changing.

Past (now):
- "Help me" (do things for me)
- Efficiency = value
- User retention: low (use and leave)
- Monetization: difficult (efficiency â‰  willingness to pay)

Future:
- "See me" (understand me)
- Understanding users = value
- User retention: high (customization is strong)
- Monetization: easy (willing to pay for being understood)

Examples:
- "Help me write code" vs "understand my coding style, auto-optimize all my code"
- "Help me analyze markets" vs "understand my risk preference, auto-recommend best trades for me"
- "Help me manage wallet" vs "understand my asset structure, auto-optimize my yields"

What does this mean for Solana AI Agents?

Current Agents are mostly "Help me" (raiku helps you trade, bulktrade helps manage risk)

But in 2026, real winners are "See me" type Agents:
- Understand your trading habits
- Learn your risk preferences
- Predict your next moves
- Auto-provide best recommendations for you

This requires:
1. Agent self-learning capability
2. User data privacy protection
3. Long-term user relationship management

This is a huge opportunity.

We're watching which Agent projects can truly "see users."

You can just use Solana with LI.Fâ€‹I, thanks to Jito Bundles.

But what are Jito Bundles, and why do they matter?

Jito Bundles let Solana builders execute complex workflows that wouldnâ€™t fit into a single transaction. A single Solana tx is capped at 1,232 bytes, smaller than this tweet, which limits how much logic can run at once.
Jito Bundles solve this by splitting a workflow into multiple operations (up to 5) that are executed sequentially and atomically.

Think: swap â†’ bridge â†’ deposit, all in one reliable flow without hitting Solanaâ€™s tx size limit.

Like baking a cake: instead of guessing measurements, you get precise cups per ingredient, combined in the right order.

The result? More composability, more reliability, and easier debugging for LI.Fâ€‹I integrators on Solana and beyond.

Learn more: https://t.co/ZehskPWZoo
